[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/ParliamentContract_ACS1_TransactionFeeProvider.cs] [Function: SetMethodFee()] [Input Validation] If input.Fees contains duplicate symbols with different BasicFee values, will the loop at line 12 validate all entries but only the last fee setting persists, allowing inconsistent fee states? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/ParliamentContract_ACS1_TransactionFeeProvider.cs] [Function: SetMethodFee()] [DoS] Can an attacker pass an input.Fees array with thousands of entries, each requiring external token validation calls, causing the transaction to exceed gas limits and preventing legitimate fee updates? [File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Parliament/ParliamentContract_ACS1_TransactionFeeProvider.cs] [Function: SetMethodFee()] [Business Logic] If input.MethodName is an empty string or null, will State.TransactionFees store a fee configuration that can never be retrieved or used, causing permanent storage waste and potential fee bypass?
